properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 3 at 9:40PM EST until January 10 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...White River...


.Additional precipitation across portions of central and southern
Indiana in the last 24 hours will prolong high water along portions
of the lower White River and East Fork White River by an additional
24 hours or so. Additional rainfall is expected late today
into Saturday, but should be light enough that impacts to river
levels will be minimal.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Petersburg.
* until Friday January 10.
* At  8:30 PM Friday the stage was 17.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 18.6 feet by Monday evening then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Thursday evening.
* At 19.0 feet...Low bottomlands flood and flooding begins on higher
bottomlands.  State Road 257 may begin to flood if Shoals gage
reading is over 17 feet.  Private levees may be overtopped in many
cases.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
